segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the Price/Sales catalogue by means of its type and number and when necessary its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the Price/sales catalogue document date.
Examples of the use of this DTM segment are: Lead times that apply to the whole Price/Sales catalogue or expiration date/time of the Price/sales catalogue.
The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date/time/period requires to be logically related to another specified data item. e.g. the Reference date is specified within the RFF segment group.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating special conditions related to the total Price/sales catalogue owing to origin, customs preference, or other commercial factors.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message, e.g. request for price information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate, a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information relevant to the price/sales catalogue.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions. Identification of the sender and receiver parties is mandatory for the Price/sales catalogue message. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. The sender and the receiver are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the other parties specified in the message may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments giving contact details of the person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments specifying tax related information, valid for the whole Price/sales catalogue, e.g. Value Added Tax at the standard rate is applicable for all items.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee, e.g. a stamp fee.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole Price/sales catalogue. Currency data maybe omitted in national applications but will be required for international transactions.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the Price/sales catalogue, e.g. the Price/sales catalogue currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the whole Price/sales catalogue.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, instalments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as instalment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discounts, penalties or instalments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport and locations relating to the whole Price/sales catalogue.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods listed in the Price/sales catalogue. If required, the carrier's address should be indicated within the NAD segment group.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment, e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole Price/sales catalogue.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms to be used, e.g. UN INCOTERMS.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the whole Price/sales catalogue. The allowance or charge specified within this segment group may either relate to the total Price/sales catalogue in which case it cannot be overridden at detail level, or it can relate to the line items as a default allowance/charge and can be overridden by the ALC segment group within the detail section. Where relevant, additional information, date information, tax/fee details are to be indicated. The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the segment group 11-14) should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating any dates, times or periods applicable to the allowances and charges specified at heading level.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified, e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the quantity of goods ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge rate is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount for the allowance or charge. (e.g. a stamp fee).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to identify technical rules applicable for all products contained in the message and the rules' issue dates.

segment.name: Technical rules
segment.documentation: TRU, A segment identifying technical rules and conditions relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation:
DTM, A segment specifying dates associated with the technical rules.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: SG30-SG31-SG32-SG33-SG34-SG35-SG36 A group of segments enabling the standard commercial factors relevant to a specific group of items to be specified. e.g. quantity related price break factors or minimum order quantity.

segment.name: Product group information
segment.documentation: PGI, A segment identifying the products Price/Tariff group where applicable.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating date/time/period related to the price group. e.g. expiration date/time or validity period for the price group. Lead time of the goods/services mentioned in the price group can also be provided by the DTM segment.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities related to the specified price group, e.g. minimum order quantity.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the price group is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed for the specification of the price group. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole pricing group.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the Price/sales catalogue, e.g. the Price/sales catalogue currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments identifying the details of the price information for the product or service identified in the Price group.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment providing either the unit or reference price and the price type, valid for the pricing group.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency in which the price is expressed.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to identify additional pricing information related to the class or type of trade and additionally identifying the reason for any change.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a quantity or an amount range to which the price information applies.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the price information, e.g. period of validity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments specifying tax related information, valid for the pricing group.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee, e.g. a stamp fee.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the whole pricing group. The allowances or charges specified within group 19 may either relate to the total pricing group in which case it cannot be overridden at price item level, or it can relate to the price item level as a default allowance/charge and can be overridden by the ALC group within at the price item level. When relevant, additional information, tax details may be indicated. The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the groups 20-23 should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors..

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified. e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the quantity of goods ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. The allowance/charge rate is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount for the allowance or charge. (e.g. a stamp fee).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments identifying the parties with the associated information relevant for the pricing group.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified. e.g. The sender and the receiver are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required, but the other parties specified in the message may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the NAD segment e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments giving references only relevant to the specified party.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number and where appropriate a line number within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments giving contact details of the person or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the whole pricing group.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, instalments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as instalment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discounts, penalties or instalments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, and locations relating to the whole pricing group.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods listed in the Price/sales catalogue. If required, the carrier's address should be indicated within the NAD segment group.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment, e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole pricing group.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms to be used. e.g. UN INCOTERMS.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments specifying the packaging, physical dimensions for goods referenced by the price group. If required, providing handling instructions and notification of hazardous materials, relating to the price group.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the physical type of packages for the price group. e.g. pallets.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment e.g. pallet size.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling instructions of materials and additionally, if required, notifying hazardous materials in the whole pricing group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments that refers, through an external file identification, to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system e.g. hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving a reference related to the file identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segments to identify technical rules applicable for the current product group and the rules' issue dates.

segment.name: Technical rules
segment.documentation: TRU, A segment identifying technical rules and conditions applying to a product group.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates associated with the technical rules and issue dates applying to a product group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: PTY-FTX-SG37-SG38-SG39-SG40-SG41-SG47-SG48- SG49-SG50-SG51-SG52-SG54-SG55-SG56 A group of segments providing the relevant price/sales information for the specified product/service.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item (or sub-line item in a configuration).

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment for identifying a product in the Price Catalogue.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or service as well as its characteristics. This segment should be used for products or services that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to allow physical measurements and dimensions to be stated, where this is required for identification of the product.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities related to the specified price item line, e.g. minimum order quantity.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of materials in the line item, and additionally, if required, notifying hazardous materials.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment specifying the relevant additional information for an item, e.g. country of origin.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date, and when relevant, the time or period of an activity identified by the date/time/period qualifier. e.g. expiration date of the price/sales catalogue for the price item line.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference, which is related to the described article, by its number.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to indicate country of origin and country of the despatch.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to indicate that a movement certificate is required.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment to provide a priority which is associated with the item being described.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed at the line item levelled within other segment. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: A group of segments providing product characteristic and product characteristic details.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify common product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic value being physical measurement (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments specifying a tax type, category and rate relating to the item.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying a tax type, category and rate, or exemption.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the amount for the identified tax/fee, e.g. a stamp fee.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 39: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the Price item line.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the Price/sales catalogue, e.g. the Price/sales catalogue currency. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 40: A group of segments identifying the details of the price information for the product or service identified in the LIN segment group.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment providing either the unit or reference price and the price type, valid for the pricing group.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency in which the price is expressed.

segment.name: Additional price information
segment.documentation: APR, A segment to identify additional pricing information related to the class or type of trade and additionally identifying the reason for any change.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a quantity or an amount range to which the price information applies.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to identify the date/time/period information related to the price information, e.g. period of validity.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to indicate percentage increase of decrease in price since last information.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, This segment is used to provide locations related to the price such as market region.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 41: A group of segments specifying allowances and charges for the price item line. When relevant, additional information, date information, tax details may be indicated. The basis for the calculation of the allowance/charge may be a quantity, a percentage, an amount or a rate and one of the groups 39-40 should be used accordingly.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and, where necessary its calculation sequence.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating any dates, times or periods applicable to the allowances and charges specified at detail level.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, This segment is used to provide locations related to the allowance or charge, such as market region.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 42: A group of segments specifying the quantity of the allowance or charge with its measure unit specifier. A range to which the allowance or charge applies may be specified. e.g. An allowance of a free quantity of 20 pieces may be specified if the quantity of goods ordered is greater than 1000 pieces.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range to which the allowance or charge applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 43: A group of segments specifying the percentage for the allowance or charge, e.g. The allowance/charge amount is calculated as 5% of the goods value or a price reduction of 5% may be specified if the goods quantity ordered is within the range 5 tons to 10 tons.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment identifying the percentage and the percentage basis for the calculation of the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 44: A group of segments specifying a monetary amount for an allowance or charge. A range to which the allowance or charge applies can be specified, e.g. an allowance of 5000 BEF may be specified if goods value ordered is greater than 100000 BEF.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment identifying the monetary amount for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, a range for the application of the allowance/charge amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 45: A group of segments specifying the rate per unit and basis to which the allowance or charge applies, e.g. the allowance/charge rate is 3 DEM per 10 tons.

segment.name: Rate details
segment.documentation: RTE, A segment specifying the rate per unit and the basis for calculation.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment specifying, if required, the range for the application of the allowance/charge rate.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 46: A group of segments of segments specifying tax related information for the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category, and rate, or exemption, related to the allowance or charge.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying a monetary amount for the allowance or charge. (e.g. a stamp fee).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of application of the specified tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 47: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, for the Price item line. If required, providing handling instructions and notification of hazardous materials.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the physical type of packages for the Price item line.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment e.g. box size.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment specifying the maximum quantity number of packages which can be stacked safely on another package and/or the number of items normally contained within the package.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of materials in the price item line, and additionally, if required, notifying hazardous materials.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 48: A group of segments specifying the terms of payment applicable for the Price item line.

segment.name: Payment terms
segment.documentation: PYT, A segment identifying the payment terms and date/time basis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment giving the specific date/time/period, if needed, of any payments, discounts, instalments etc.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the discount, interest, penalty as well as instalment percentage.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to payment discounts, penalties or instalments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 49: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, and locations relating to the Price line item.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode, means and identification of the transport for the goods listed in the Price/sales catalogue. If required, the carrier's address should be indicated within the NAD segment group.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment, e.g. place of departure or border crossing point.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 50: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the Price line item.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms to be used. e.g. UN INCOTERMS.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms specified in the TOD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 51: A group of segments that refers through an external file identification to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system, e.g. hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving a reference related to the file identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 52: A group of segments identifying a party with associated information for the current product.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 53: A group of segments giving contact details of the person or department within the party.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department and to whom the communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the current contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 54: A group of segments to identify technical rules applicable for the actual product and the rules' issue dates.

segment.name: Technical rules
segment.documentation: TRU, A segment identifying technical rules and conditions relevant for the current product.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates associated with the technical rules.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 55: A group of segments containing dangerous goods information relevant to the current product.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment providing dangerous goods information for the current product by using relevant dangerous goods identification.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify quantity for the given dangerous goods.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in clear form, related to dangerous goods. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 56: A group of segments to specify hierarchical connections from the given product to higher or lower levelled products.

segment.name: Hierarchy information
segment.documentation: HYN, A segment to identify hierarchical connections from the given product to higher or lower levelled products and its function.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing either additional identification of the product specified in the hierarchy segment or any substitute product identification.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the child product's quantity contained within the identified parent product.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information on the actual product and its hierarchical connections is required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 57: A group of segments to provide references linked to the hierarchical item and where necessary the reference date.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference linked to the hierarchical item, for example the drawing number on a wiring diagram.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and, or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 58: A group of segments to identify characteristics depending on the product's use within the hierarchy specific to the identified party.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 59: A segment group to specify party dependent information for the actual product in the given hierarchy.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party preferably in coded form to which specific product and hierarchical item characteristics apply.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification(s) of the hierarchically linked product that are specific to the identified party, for example an additional number from another origin to identify the higher or lower levelled product relevant to the identified party.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the child product's quantity contained within the identified parent product if specially defined by the named party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 60: A group of segments to identify characteristics depending on the product's use within the hierarchy specific to the identified party.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify product-characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.
